summary.text:
RX2 data rate frequency.
The second receive window (RX2) uses a fixed frequency and data rate.
This value configures the frequency to use in RX2.
Changing the desired value makes the Network Server transmit the RXParamSetupReq MAC command.

text.comment: RX2 data rate frequency. The second receive window (RX2) uses a fixed frequency and data rate. This value configures the frequency to use in RX2. Changing the desired value makes the Network Server transmit the RXParamSetupReq MAC command.

summary.text: The transmission speed or Data Rate of a LoRaWAN message, ranging from

(lowest Data Rate).
Making the spreading factor

) allows you to roughly send the same amount of data use half the time on air.
Lowering the spreading factor makes it more difficult for the gateway to receive a transmission, as it will be more sensitive to noise.

text.comment:
The transmission speed or Data Rate of a LoRaWAN message, ranging from SF7 (highest Data Rate) to SF12 (lowest Data Rate). Making the spreading factor 1 step lower (from SF10 to SF9) allows you to roughly send the same amount of data use half the time on air. Lowering the spreading factor makes it more difficult for the gateway to receive a transmission, as it will be more sensitive to noise.

See:

https://www.thethingsnetwork.org/docs/lorawan/spreading-factors/
